name: Metallic Rebuke
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

editions.flavor:
"Too little, too late. The machine is in motion."
â€”Tezzeret
When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.
When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.
When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

name: Metallurgeon
text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

editions.flavor: "By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."
"By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."

name: Metallurgic Summonings
text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create an X/X colorless Construct artifact creature token, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
{3}{U}{U}, Exile Metallurgic Summonings: Return all instant and sorcery cards from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if you control six or more artifacts.

name: Metalspinner's Puzzleknot
text:
When Metalspinner's Puzzleknot enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
{2}{B}, Sacrifice Metalspinner's Puzzleknot: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

name: Metalwork Colossus
text:
Metalwork Colossus costs {X} less to cast, where X is the total converted mana cost of noncreature artifacts you control.
Sacrifice two artifacts: Return Metalwork Colossus from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Metalworker
text: {T}: Reveal any number of artifact cards in your hand. Add {C}{C} to your mana pool for each card revealed this way.

editions.flavor:
"At this rate I fully expect to be replaced by a clockwork golem by year's end."
â€”Barrin

name: Metamorphic Wurm
text: Threshold â€” Metamorphic Wurm gets +4/+4 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Only a handful have seen it transform. Or, from the wurm's perspective, only a mouthful.

name: Metamorphose
text: Put target permanent an opponent controls on top of its owner's library. That opponent may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: If it's not one thing, it's another.

name: Metamorphosis
text:
As an additional cost to cast Metamorphosis, sacrifice a creature.
Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is one plus the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

name: Metathran Aerostat
text:
Flying
{X}{U}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, return Metathran Aerostat to its owner's hand.

name: Metathran Elite
text: Metathran Elite can't be blocked as long as it's enchanted.

editions.flavor: If the eyes are windows to the soul, their souls are not of this world.

name: Metathran Soldier
text: Metathran Soldier can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: Just as Serra crafted angels of light and faith, Urza constructed an army of sorcery and power to resist the coming invasion.

name: Metathran Transport
text:
Flying
Metathran Transport can't be blocked by blue creatures.
{U}: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn.

name: Metathran Zombie
text: {B}: Regenerate Metathran Zombie.

editions.flavor:
"Rise, metathran. You shall serve a nobler cause in death."
â€”Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

name: Meteor Blast
text: Meteor Blast deals 4 damage to each of X target creatures and/or players.

editions.flavor: "Behold astronomy's contribution to war."â€”Fennor Rhyl, starcaller

name: Meteor Crater
text: {T}: Choose a color of a permanent you control. Add one mana of that color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Legend has it that meteor craters are haunted by the ghosts of those who died on impact.

name: Meteorite
text:
When Meteorite enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "And if I'm lying," he began . . .
"And if I'm lying," he began . . .

name: Meteor Shower
text: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

editions.flavor:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
â€”Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
â€”Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Meteor Storm
text: {2}{R}{G}, Discard two cards at random: Meteor Storm deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The storm wasn't an omen. It was the fulfillment of one.

name: Metrognome
text:
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Metrognome, create four 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature tokens.
{4}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature token.

name: Metropolis Sprite
text:
Flying
{U}: Metropolis Sprite gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Well, if that goblin didn't want his tongue pierced, he shouldn't have stuck it out at me."

name: Miasmic Mummy
text: When Miasmic Mummy enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

editions.flavor: Its breath doesn't assault the senses. It pollutes the mind.

name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
text: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, that player sacrifices a permanent.

editions.flavor:
"Watch over my father. Tell him I'm safe, but I won't come home until I find out how to bring him back to his senses, and Kamigawa is again at peace."
â€”Michiko Konda, last letter to General Takeno

name: Midnight Banshee
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each nonblack creature.

editions.flavor: Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.
Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.

name: Midnight Charm
text:
Choose one â€”
â€¢ Midnight Charm deals 1 damage to target creature and you gain 1 life.
â€¢ Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
â€¢ Tap target creature.

name: Midnight Covenant
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."

editions.flavor:
"Not all mortals fought the kami. The ogres revered the oni, while some humans made pacts based upon empty promises."
â€”The History of Kamigawa

name: Midnight Duelist
text: Protection from Vampires

editions.flavor: Avacyn's return did not rid him of his desire for revenge.

name: Midnight Entourage
text:
Other Aetherborn you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Midnight Entourage or another Aetherborn you control dies, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

name: Midnight Guard
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.

editions.flavor:
"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
â€”Olgard of the Skiltfolk

"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
â€”Olgard of the Skiltfolk

name: Midnight Haunting
text: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

editions.flavor: The path back to the world of the living is murky and bewildering. A geist may not even realize that it's terrifying its own loved ones.
The path back to the world of the living is murky and bewildering. A geist may not even realize that it's terrifying its own loved ones.

name: Midnight Oil
text:
Midnight Oil enters the battlefield with seven hour counters on it.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card and remove two hour counters from Midnight Oil.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of hour counters on Midnight Oil.
Whenever you discard a card, you lose 1 life.

name: Midnight Recovery
text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

name: Midnight Ritual
text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.
Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.

name: Midnight Scavengers
text:
When Midnight Scavengers enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
(Melds with Graf Rats.)

name: Midsummer Revel
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Midsummer Revel.
{G}, Sacrifice Midsummer Revel: Create X 3/3 green Beast creature tokens, where X is the number of verse counters on Midsummer Revel.

name: Midvast Protector
text: When Midvast Protector enters the battlefield, target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "I cultivated my faith in Avacyn despite meager returns. Now my faith is repaid."

name: Might Beyond Reason
text:
Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
Delirium â€” Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

name: Might Makes Right
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control each creature on the battlefield with the greatest power, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

editions.flavor: An oath of fealty sworn with a handshake.

name: Might of Alara
text: Domain â€” Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: The combined strength of all five planes spawned creations none had seen before.

name: Might of Oaks
text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"

May your weapon be no sword forged. May your armor be no metal wrought.
â€”Elvish saying
"Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
Suddenly, she couldn't see the acorns for the trees.
"Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
"Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"

name: Might of Old Krosa
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If you cast this spell during your main phase, that creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead.

editions.flavor: Sometimes even humble forest creatures were gifted with mighty emanations from the past.

"Krosa the great. Krosa the enduring. Look to the forest, and it will share its bounty."
â€”Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Might of the Masses
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature you control.

editions.flavor: The Joraga elves never need ask a troll to leave their territory. They merely grant it their combined strength, and it can't resist embarking on a merry rampage.
The Joraga elves never need ask a troll to leave their territory. They merely grant it their combined strength, and it can't resist embarking on a merry rampage.

name: Might of the Nephilim
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each of its colors.

editions.flavor:
"Send a runner to Tin Street, and tell 'em the delivery has been . . . uh . . . held up."
â€”Bonmod, caravan rear guard

name: Might Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +2/+2.

editions.flavor:
"The colossal thing rumbled over the ridge, tree husks crumbling before it. The ones we were already fighting howled as it came, their muscles suddenly surging, and we knew it was time to flee."
â€”Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

name: Mightstone
text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0.

editions.flavor: While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.
While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.

name: Might Weaver

editions.flavor: "Let my strength harden your resolve."
"Let my strength harden your resolve."

name: Mighty Emergence
text: Whenever a creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may put two +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: Why settle for mere enormity?

name: Mighty Leap
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

text:

Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.

name: Mikokoro, Center of the Sea
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Each player draws a card.

editions.flavor:
"Center of the Sea, Eye of the World, Shrine of Enlightenment. Seek it for answers. Seek it for healing. Seek it and return transformed."

text: Militant Inquisitor gets +1/+0 for each Equipment you control.

editions.flavor: "I am an instrument of the church wielded against Avacyn's enemies."

name: Militant Monk
text:
Vigilance
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Military Intelligence
text: Whenever you attack with two or more creatures, draw a card.

editions.flavor: To know the battlefield is to anticipate the enemy. To know the enemy is to anticipate victory.

name: Militia's Pride
text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token that's tapped and attacking.

editions.flavor: If you pick a fight with one kithkin, be ready to fight them all.

name: Millennial Gargoyle
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"You've got to keep your wits about you on the roofs. Not all stones are compliant handholds."

name: Millikin
text: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.
The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.

text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Mimeofacture
text:
Replicate {3}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Choose target permanent an opponent controls. Search that player's library for a card with the same name and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Mimic Vat
text:
Imprint â€” Whenever a nontoken creature dies, you may exile that card. If you do, return each other card exiled with Mimic Vat to its owner's graveyard.
{3}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of a card exiled with Mimic Vat. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Miming Slime
text: Create an X/X green Ooze creature token, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"We paid the Simic very well for this capability, but we should quickly recoup our expenses in saved wages."
â€”Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Mina and Denn, Wildborn
text:
You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
{R}{G}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Greenweaver Mina and her twin brother Denn lead the last of the Mul Daya into an uncertain future.

name: Minamo
text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player may draw a card. 
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, each player may return a blue card from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

name: Minamo, School at Water's Edge
text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{U}, {T}: Untap target legendary permanent.

editions.flavor: Its students graduate the school and enter history.

name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
text:
Defender
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.

editions.flavor: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.
The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

name: Minamo Sightbender
text: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.
Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.

name: Minamo's Meddling
text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller reveals his or her hand, then discards each card with the same name as a card spliced onto that spell.

editions.flavor: Like storm water through the segments of bamboo, the spell followed the links of magic. Then it destroyed them.

name: Mind
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Draw two cards.

name: Mind Bend
text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"The world, I've come to realize, is a blank canvas on which to paint."
â€”Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Mindbender Spores
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Whenever Mindbender Spores blocks a creature, put four fungus counters on that creature. The creature gains "This creature doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a fungus counter on it" and "At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fungus counter from this creature."

name: Mindblaze
text: Name a nonland card and choose a number greater than 0. Target player reveals his or her library. If that library contains exactly the chosen number of the named card, Mindblaze deals 8 damage to that player. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Mind Bomb
text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

name: Mindbreak Trap
text:
If an opponent cast three or more spells this turn, you may pay {0} rather than pay Mindbreak Trap's mana cost.
Exile any number of target spells.

editions.flavor:
"Life is a maze. This is one of its dead ends."
â€”Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Mind Burst
text: Target player discards X cards, where X is one plus the number of cards named Mind Burst in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: As haunting as a zombie's curse.

name: Mindclaw Shaman
text: When Mindclaw Shaman enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may cast an instant or sorcery card from it without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: Nicol Bolas gives power to those who will abuse it most.

name: Mind Control
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
â€”Jace Beleren

"The mind: a great weapon and an even greater weakness."
â€”Jace Beleren

"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
â€”Jace Beleren

"Every primitive mind has a motive. Easy to find, and eminently exploitable."
â€”Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
â€”Jace Beleren

name: Mindcrank
text: Whenever an opponent loses life, that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Damage dealt by sources without infect causes loss of life.)

editions.flavor:
"Let go of your memories and be reborn."
â€”Argent Etchings, plate 106, passage 27

name: Mindculling
text: You draw two cards and target opponent discards two cards.

editions.flavor:
"Why infiltrate their strongholds when what we seek resides in such a poorly guarded safe?"
â€”Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

name: Mind Extraction
text:
As an additional cost to cast Mind Extraction, sacrifice a creature.
Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of each of the sacrificed creature's colors.

name: Mindeye Drake
text:
Flying
When Mindeye Drake dies, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: They can map both the cityscape and the minds of its architects.

name: Mind Funeral
text: Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until four land cards are revealed. That player puts all cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."
â€”Sharuum the Hegemon

"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."

name: Mind Games
text:
Buyback {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Mind Grind
text: Each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals X land cards, then puts all cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard. X can't be 0.

name: Mind Harness
text:
Enchant red or green creature
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
You control enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.

name: Mind Knives
text: Target opponent discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.

name: Mindlash Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this permanent: Each player discards a card."

editions.flavor: Though Dominaria's queenless slivers lack a single purpose, in some the instinct for self-sacrifice remains extremely strong.

name: Mindleech Mass
text:
Trample
Whenever Mindleech Mass deals combat damage to a player, you may look at that player's hand. If you do, you may cast a nonland card in it without paying that card's mana cost.

name: Mindless Automaton
text:
Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

name: Mindless Null
text: Mindless Null can't block unless you control a Vampire.

editions.flavor: Only a bloodchief can create vampires. The rest sire nulls, who become mindless beasts in their former bodies.

name: Mindlock Orb
text: Players can't search libraries.

editions.flavor: Rogue mechanists once rummaged through the wastes of the Tidehollow, constructing unauthorized golems to threaten the hegemony of the sphinxes. The orbs put a stop to that.

name: Mind Maggots
text: When Mind Maggots enters the battlefield, discard any number of creature cards. For each card discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Mind Maggots.

name: Mindmelter
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Mindmelter can't be blocked.
{3}{C}: Target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Mindmoil
text: Whenever you cast a spell, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.

editions.flavor:
"My criticism of the Izzet is that their impulse for learning seems too much like impulse and too little like learning."
â€”Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Mind Over Matter
text: Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."

name: Mind Peel
text:
Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target player discards a card.

name: Mind Raker
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
When Mind Raker enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, each opponent discards a card.

editions.flavor: It consumes any dreams of victory.

name: Mind Ravel
text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.
An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.
